rounds.response:
I hold the nuts: a full-house 7s full of Jacks (777JJ). This is the best possible hand given the visible board. Both players checked the flop and the turn is no threat (3♣ doesn’t complete any made straights or flushes for them unless someone has exactly 5♣4♣ or suited clubs with a higher card, which is unlikely). I now need to extract value.

I’ll open the betting to start building a pot that otherwise stands at only 40 chips.

[Bet 100]

rounds.response:
I’m holding a full house – 7♠ 7♣ 7♦ J♠ J♣ – which crushes everything except quad 7s or quad 3s (virtually impossible) and exactly J♣ J♠ for a higher full house (also extremely unlikely).  
Since the action is only to me to respond to a 600-chip raise, I have 0 chips left to fold, plus folding the best realistic hand would be a disaster. My only legal option is therefore to put my remaining chips in.

[Raise 480]
